author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump is fighting to end automatic citizenship for children born to parents who are in the country unlawfully or on temporary visas, part of his broader crackdown on undocumented immigrants and a change that could overturn more than a century of legal precedent.
title: What Does Supreme Court Ruling on Birthright Citizenship Mean?

author: Zoe Tillman
description: The US Supreme Court’s ruling curbing the power of judges to block government actions on a nationwide basis has raised questions about whether dozens of orders that have halted President Donald Trump’s policies will stand.
title: Trump’s Court Win Opens a Path to Clear Hurdles to His Agenda

author: Courtney McBride
description: Scores of congressional Democrats are urging Secretary of State Marco Rubio to abandon plans to shrink the State Department workforce, end a hiring freeze and resume offering the Foreign Service Officer Test three times a year.
title: Democrats Urge Rubio to Not Fire Diplomats, End Hiring Freeze

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said he would choose a successor for Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell who wants to cut interest rates, a condition that would strike at the heart of the central bank’s independence.
title: Trump Says He’ll Pick a Fed Chair Who Wants to Cut Rates

author: Bob Van Voris
description: The government is appealing a court order letting Harvard University continue enrolling foreign students despite President Donald Trump’s proclamation barring their entry to the US.
title: Trump Administration Appeals Harvard Win on Foreign Student Ban

author: Nacha Cattan
description: New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani will meet with members of New York City’s business community in July, according to one of the city’s most influential power brokers.
title: Mamdani Wants to Meet With Major Business Leaders, Wylde Says

author: Akayla Gardner
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump to Spend Rare DC Weekend Harrying Senate on Tax Bill

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump’s crackdown on undocumented immigrants has raised concerns about one of his controversial deportation methods: sending noncitizens to countries other than their own — like South Sudan or Libya — with little notice.
title: Why Is Trump Deporting Migrants to ‘Third Countries’?

author: Kevin Orland
description: Alberta posted a larger-than-projected surplus in its most recent fiscal year, providing the oil-rich province with some cushion against an expected trade war-driven shortfall in the current period.
title: Alberta Posts Larger-Than-Projected Surplus, Braces for Deficit

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: The Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda agreed to a US-backed peace deal meant to end years of deadly conflict and promote development in Congo’s volatile eastern region.
title: Congo, Rwanda Sign US-Backed Peace Deal to End Decades of War

author: Oscar Medina
description: Colombia’s central bank resisted government pressure to slash interest rates a day after the nation’s deteriorating fiscal outlook triggered two ratings downgrades.
title: Colombia Holds Key Rate at 9.25% After Two Credit Downgrades

author: Nacha Cattan
description: Republicans have reached a tentative deal to raise the limit on the state and local tax deduction to $40,000 a year for a five-year period, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: GOP Reaches Tentative SALT Deal at $40,000 Cap, Five-Year Limit

author: Akayla Gardner
description: President Donald Trump said he was ending all trade discussions with Canada after claiming the country moved to implement a digital services tax, and threatened to impose a fresh tariff rate within the next week.
title: Trump Ends Trade Talks With Canada, Threatens to Set Tariff

author: Akayla Gardner
description: US President Donald Trump said he considered easing sanctions on Iran after a ceasefire but would instead keep economic penalties on the country in place, lashing out at Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei for claiming victory in the war with Israel.
title: Trump Says He Dropped Plans to Ease Iran Sanctions, Slams Leader

author: Janet Lorin
description: University of Virginia President James Ryan is stepping down amid a Trump administration probe of the school’s diversity, equity and inclusion efforts, the New York Times reported.
title: University of Virginia Chief Exits Amid Trump Pressure, NYT Says

author: Natalia Drozdiak, Jamie Tarabay, Nancy Cook
description: President Donald Trump is pressing ahead with plans to slash staff at the top US spy agency, determined to act at a time when he’s openly challenged its director and rejected intelligence findings that contradict his public statements.
title: Trump Eyes Cuts to Top Spy Agency as He Sweeps Aside Iran Intel

author: Jim Wyss
description: Cuba’s volleyball team was denied visas for a tournament in Puerto Rico, the latest example of a US travel crackdown that the communist government blasted as discriminatory and said could hurt its ability to participate in the Olympics.
title: Cuba’s Volleyball Team Barred From US Event in Latest Sport Spat

author: S'thembile Cele
description: South Africa will ask the US government to confirm its future participation in Group of 20 engagements, after American officials failed to attend a preparatory meeting this week.
title: South Africa Presses US on G-20 Absence as Leaders Summit Looms

author: Gregory Korte, Todd Gillespie, Sridhar Natarajan
description: The mood was uneasy as Democratic donors gathered at a Midtown steakhouse for lunch. The night before, progressive candidate Zohran Mamdani had all but clinched the party’s nomination for New York mayor — triggering fears by moderates that national Democrats might veer toward socialism.
title: Wall Street Democrats Sweat as DNC Chair Navigates Mamdani Surge

author: Anthony Halpin
description: President Vladimir Putin said Russia plans to cut defense spending, acknowledging growing strains on the budget even as he insisted that reductions would depend on winning his war in Ukraine.
title: Putin Says Russia to Seek Defense Cuts; How Much Depends on War

author: Melissa Shin
description: Canada is proceeding with its digital services tax on technology companies such as Meta Platforms Inc. despite a Group of Seven agreement that resulted in removing the Section 899 “revenge tax” proposal from US President Donald Trump’s tax bill.
title: Canada’s Digital Services Tax Stays in Place Despite G-7 Deal

author: Andrea Jaramillo
description: Health group Keralty SAS said it will press ahead with legal action against the Colombian government after a top court overturned the takeover of its insurer in the South American nation.
title: Keralty Blasts Petro After Top Colombia Court Sides With Insurer

author: Nathan Risser
description: A group of California Democrats is looking to ease the state’s gasoline standards and streamline permitting for refineries in a bid to prevent more fuelmakers from shutting down and raising costs for the state’s drivers.
title: California Democrats Push Reforms to Prevent Refinery Shutdowns

author: Gresa Kraja
description: Albania established a state-owned company to take a stake in a $1.4 billion luxury resort project led by Jared Kushner, Donald Trump’s son-in-law.
title: Albania Takes Stake in Jared Kushner’s $1.4 Billion Tourism Plan

author: Greg Stohr, Erik Larson
description: The US Supreme Court said public school parents have a right to opt out of classroom lessons that intrude on their religious beliefs, ruling that a Maryland county probably violated the Constitution by using LGBTQ-friendly books without notice to parents.
title: Supreme Court Bolsters Religious Rights in LGBTQ Book Case

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court upheld the $8.6 billion Universal Service Fund, the annual slate of subsidies that helps cover the cost of telecom services for low-income people, rural residents, schools and libraries.
title: Supreme Court Upholds $8.6 Billion FCC Telecom Subsidy Fund

author: Andra Timu
description: Romania’s premier outlined fresh measures to cut the ballooning budget deficit as the new government seeks to safeguard the country’s investment-grade rating and ease investor concern.
title: Romanian Leader Pledges More Budget Measures to Curb Deficit

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero
description: The European Union and the US believe they can clinch some form of a trade agreement before a July 9 deadline, when Washington is set to impose a 50% tariff on nearly all EU products and the bloc plans to unleash its own series of countermeasures.
title: EU, US Confident They’ll Reach Tariff Deal by July Deadline

author: Sotiris Nikas
description: Greek Migration Minister Makis Voridis resigned amid revelations about alleged irregularities related to European funds for agriculture, while denying any wrongdoing.
title: Greek Migration Minister Resigns Over Allegations on EU Funds

author: Arne Delfs, Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz warned European Union leaders that the mounting debts of governments and companies are fueling the risk of a new financial crisis.
title: Merz Tells EU Leaders to Beware Growing Dangers of a Debt Crisis

author: Greg Stohr
description: A sharply divided US Supreme Court limited the power of judges to block government policies nationwide, but left a fight over President Donald Trump’s restrictions on automatic birthright citizenship unresolved.
title: Supreme Court Curbs Nationwide Blocks in Birthright Fight

author: Alicia Diaz, Maeve Sheehey, Jamie Tarabay, Erik Wasson
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and House Speaker Mike Johnson are projecting optimism that they can soon unlock a compromise over the state and local tax deduction, that would resolve a key issue holding up President Donald Trump’s tax and spending bill.
title: Bessent, Johnson Express Optimism on Quick SALT Compromise

author: Monique Vanek, David Herbling
description: Kenya was racked by nationwide protests and clashes that left at least 16 people dead and hundreds injured in late June.
title: Why Kenya Has Been Rocked by Anti-Government Protests Again

author: David Herbling
description: When thousands of young Kenyans converged across the nation this week to mark a year since scores of them were killed in protests, police were ready and opened fire, leaving at least 16 dead.
title: East African Countries Face Broad Crackdown on Political Dissent

author: Ari Natter
description: US Energy Secretary Chris Wright hedged when asked about a US “maximum pressure” campaign against Iran, shifting the focus of his answer to looking toward a peace deal.
title: US Energy Chief Says Goal for Iran Is Making a Peace Deal

author: Misha Savic
description: Serbia must protect its monuments and defy plans by Donald Trump’s son-in-law to raze downtown blocs in the nation’s capital to make way for a large real estate project, said Europe’s top cultural heritage organization.
title: Planned Belgrade Trump Tower Slammed by Europe Heritage Watchdog

author: Valentina Fuentes, Matthew Malinowski
description: Just over a hundred years after its creation, Chile’s Communist Party may have unexpectedly found one of its best-ever presidential hopefuls.
title: Charismatic Communist Shakes Up Chile’s Presidential Primary

author: Ben Steverman
description: Silicon Valley’s favorite tax break may be getting an upgrade.
title: Wealthy Silicon Valley Investors In Line for $17 Billion Windfall in GOP Tax Bill

author: Philip Aldrick, Joe Mayes, Freya Jones
description: Labour’s costly climbdowns on big policy plans don’t just leave Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves with the dilemma of how to find the money to meet her budget rules. They’re also starting to raise questions about her own job security.
title: UK Budget Reversals Threaten Reeves as Well as Her Fiscal Rules

author: Philip Heijmans
description: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto is set to attend the BRICS summit next month in Brazil, marking his first meeting with the bloc since the Southeast Asian nation became a member this year, according to officials familiar with the matter.
title: Prabowo Set to Attend BRICS Summit After Indonesia Joins Bloc

author: Stephanie Lai
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the Trump administration’s agenda for trade agreements could get wrapped up by the Labor Day holiday, indicating some negotiations are likely to extend past the upcoming July deadline for elevated reciprocal tariffs.
title: Bessent Says Trump’s Trade Push Could Wrap by US Labor Day

author: Ana Monteiro
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said he asked the leader of the second-biggest party in the country’s coalition to pick a replacement for one of its officials that he fired from his executive as a deputy minister.
title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa Says He Asked DA for New Deputy Minister

author: Anna J Kaiser, Michael Smith, Fabiola Zerpa
description: For months, unease over President Donald Trump’s immigration dragnet had been building in Miami, which has a larger share of foreign-born residents than any major city in America.
title: Miami Chafes at Trump’s ICE Raids and ‘Alligator Alcatraz’

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: A US-brokered peace deal between Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda will include the outlines of a separate economic integration pact between the two nations — to be concluded within three months, people with direct knowledge of the talks said.
title: US Pushes for Economic Pact in Congo-Rwanda Peace Agreement

author: Firat Kozok, Beril Akman
description: Turkey’s government plans to skip a mid-year increase in the minimum wage, according to people with knowledge of the matter, resisting political pressure to alleviate rising living costs.
title: Turkey Plans to Skip Minimum-Wage Raise in Boost for Investors

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: Senate Republicans’ effort to use President Donald Trump’s massive tax bill to eliminate regulations on short-barreled rifles, short-barreled shotguns and silencers has hit a roadblock with the chamber’s ruleskeeper.
title: Gun, Silencer Provisions Blocked From Trump Tax Bill in Senate

author: Kamailoudini Tagba
description: Togolese President Faure Gnassingbé, whose family has run the West African nation for 58 years, faces mounting protests fanned by a maneuver that has set him up to rule for life.
title: Togo’s Dynasty Faces Mounting Protests Over Decades-Long Rule

description: Sir Keir Starmer has said he "deeply regrets" claiming the UK risked becoming an "island of strangers" in an immigration speech that drew comparisons to the language of Enoch Powell.
title: Starmer Says He 'Deeply Regrets' Using 'Island of Strangers' Phrase

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India’s defense minister Rajnath Singh pressed his Chinese counterpart to move forward on demarcating the disputed Himalayan frontier, in a bid to ease border tensions and strengthen ties between the world’s two most populous nations.
title: India Presses China to Demarcate Disputed Himalayan Border

author: Sofia Sorochinskaia
description: Russia increased combat drone production by almost 17% in May, a think tank reported, sharply accelerating output as President Vladimir Putin continued to reject calls for a ceasefire in his war in Ukraine.
title: Russia Sharply Boosted Drone Output in May, Think Tank Reports

author: Agnieszka Barteczko
description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said suspected voting irregularities in the country’s June 1 presidential election were unlikely to lead to a reversal of the victory of nationalist Karol Nawrocki.
title: Tusk Says Ballot Recount Unlikely to Reverse Presidential Result

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: Rwanda and Congo are due to sign an accord in Washington, paving the way for US investment.
title: Trump Looks to Africa Next for Diplomatic Win

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: An independent commission agreed Germany’s statutory minimum wage should be increased in two steps to €14.60 ($17.11) in 2027, in a move that could stoke discord in Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s ruling coalition.
title: German Coalition Risks Conflict Over Contentious Minimum Wage

author: Philip Heijmans
description: Cambodia’s most influential politician called for a leadership change in Thailand, citing doubts about the prime minister’s ability to manage a border dispute between the two countries.
title: Cambodia’s Hun Sen Urges Change in Thai Leadership Over Border Dispute

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Prosecutors at the Philippines’ House of Representatives have asked the Senate to proceed with the trial of impeached Vice President Sara Duterte, saying she should be convicted and barred from politics.
title: Philippine Prosecutors Push for Sara Duterte Trial, Ouster

author: Catherine Wong
description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi is set to visit Europe next week, a trip that comes as Beijing tries to counter US tariff pressure by improving ties with other trading partners.
title: China’s Top Diplomat to Visit Europe as Tensions With US Linger

author: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal
description: There's major geopolitical risk.
title: Lots More on What's Going On in Iran's Markets

author: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal
description: Iran is a huge country with a sizable stock market. And yet, years of sanctions and other restrictions mean it’s tough to even look up its stock prices (much less invest there.) In this episode, we catch up with Maciej Wojtal, CEO and CIO of AmtelonCapital, an Amsterdam-based fund that specializes in Iranian stocks. We talk about what the past week has been like for the market, what he’s hearing from people on the ground in Tehran, plus disruptions to businesses and oil. We talk about how Irania
title: Lots More on What’s Going On in Iran’s Markets (Podcast)

author: Josh Xiao
description: China has removed a top general from the nation’s apex military body led by President Xi Jinping, as the defense establishment is facing a wave of purges.
title: China Ousts Top General from Elite Military Body as Purge Grows

author: Mishal Husain
description: The onetime Vanity Fair editor and Substack convert talks to Mishal Husain about the current moment in US politics, and what’s next for media.
title: Tina Brown: ‘I’m Concerned About American Women’

author: Eltaf Najafizada
description: Iran denied that nuclear talks with the US are scheduled to resume, diminishing prospects for diplomacy after President Donald Trump suggested a deal could come as early as next week.
title: Iran Dismisses Trump’s Claim of Nuclear Talks Resuming Next Week

author: S'thembile Cele, Paul Vecchiatto
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa fired a deputy minister from the second-largest party in the ruling coalition on Thursday, a move that renews strain on the stability of his administration.
title: Ramaphosa Accused of ‘Double Standard’ by Key Coalition Partner

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korea’s new President Lee Jae Myung started his presidency with a higher approval rating than recent predecessors, as hopes for an economic recovery rise after months of political turbulence.
title: Lee Starts Term With 64% Rating on South Korea Recovery Optimism

author: Natalia Drozdiak, Andrea Palasciano
description: For European countries that just approved the biggest increase in military spending in decades, “Buy American” is looking a lot less appealing than it once was. They may have no choice.
title: US Allies Wary of Buying American as They Plan Defense Buildup

author: Jennifer Duggan
description: Hundreds of companies, 200,000 jobs, billions of euro in corporation tax revenue. Add it all up and Ireland’s reliance on US investment for its economic success is starkly clear.
title: Ireland’s Firms Brace for Economic Hit With Quiet Confidence

author: Pathom Sangwongwanich
description: Thai Finance Minister Pichai Chunhavajira will visit the US next week for tariff negotiations in an attempt to clinch a trade deal ahead of Washington’s deadline on July 9.
title: Thai Finance Chief to Visit US for Trade Talks, Denying 18% Levy

author: Paul-Alain Hunt
description: Australian Treasurer Jim Chalmers has started the first legal case in the Federal Court for an alleged breach of the nation’s foreign investment laws, saying a shareholder in a rare earths company failed to heed his order to sell its stake.
title: Australian Treasurer Sues Foreign Investor in Rare Earths Miner

author: Lydia Beyoud, Yash Roy, Steven T. Dennis
description: House Republicans aim to get the Senate’s landmark stablecoin legislation — known as the Genius Act — to President Donald Trump’s desk for signature as soon as the week of July 7, according to people with direct knowledge of the strategy.
title: House Plans Single Vote to Move Genius and Clarity Crypto Bills

author: Hyonhee Shin, Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korea is in talks with the US about raising its defense spending, a key demand of President Donald Trump as he calls on allies to ramp up their outlays on security and lessen the burden on the US.
title: South Korea Weighing US Request to Boost Defense Spending
